data.why:
Text::CStatiBR creates a seven columns CSV file output with one
    line for each token per text, given as input a corpus that files
    names follows ' 1 (1). txt', '1 (2). txt', ..., '1 (n).txt' or 1
    \(([1-9]|[1-9][0-9]+)\).txt Columns stores statistical information:
    (1) Number of word forms in document d; (2) Number of tokens in d;
    (3) Id number of d, ie., n; (4) Frequency of term t in d; (5) Corpus
    frequency of t ; (6) Document frequency of t (number of documents
    where t occurs at least once); (7) t, UTF8 Latin coded string
    delimited by /[ -@]|[\[-`]|[{-Â¿]|[ɐ-˩]|[ʹ-�]/

    Main output file name is '1 (n + 5).txt' and it is stored in the
    same directory as the corpus, together with residual files on each
    input file with .txu and .txv extensions.

meta.subject: PAUSE ID request (FERNANDES; Rodrigo Panchiniak Fernandes)
